title: Blended Learning-Based Microlearning Course for Enhancing East Asian Music Education

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental Music Theory and Instrument Performance Experience
context.additional_context: Combines digital device-based East Asian music theory/practice education, aiming to engage learners and modernize traditional music applications

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish the basic scales and rhythmic systems of traditional Korean, Chinese, and Japanese music with over 85% accuracy.
Within one week, learners acquire at least three performance techniques of East Asian instruments (e.g., gayageum, erhu, shamisen) via mobile learning modules.
In a blended learning environment, learners produce one creative performance video through peer assessment and incorporate feedback.

resources: East Asian Music Theory Video Content

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
